DOC.brief_summary: The purpose present study evaluate whether prebiotics - ITF ( Inulin/OFS 75/25 ) effective treat patient non-alcoholic liver disease .
DOC.brief_title: Prebiotics Patients With Non-alcoholic Liver Disease
DOC.detailed_description: The study include 60 patient Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease ( NAFLD ) randomize two group , receive either ITF ( Inulin/oligofructose-OFS 75/25 ) maltodextrin ( placebo ) . The trial last 20 week : Stage 1-Run-in period : Subjects follow ascertain weight maintenance . Stage 2- Randomized intervention period : Subjects assign receive 16 gram/day ITF maltodextrin . Both ITF placebo provide identical opaque package subject researcher blind content . Stage 3- Extension period : All patient receive 16 gram/day ITF 8 week . After sign informed consent , follow data collect : demographic , lifestyle habit include dietary questionnaire , medical history . At end week 2 , week 12 week 20 follow test perform : Vital Signs : blood pressure , anthropometric measurement , body composition determine bioelectrical impedance analysis ( BIA ) . Biochemical blood test : liver function test fast glucose insulin & lipid profile , 75 gram oral glucose tolerance test ( OGTT ) , CRP ( inflammation marker ) , SCFA , BCAA , LBP FGF 19 . Fecal sample : fecal sample use microbiota composition analysis , BA analysis . Assessment liver status At week 2 , 12 , 20 use magnetic resonance spectroscopy ( 1H-MRS ) , SteatoTest NashTest ( FibroMax™ ) liver enzymes evaluate steohepatitis .
